WRITING.TITLE: I was introduced to synth genre/subgenres 4 days ago I can already tell this music will stay with me until my end.
WRITING.TEXT:
Just fell upon this beautiful music genre of Synth(Synthwave).
And till date I've listened to OGRE, Perturbator, Lazerhawk, Miami Nights 1984, GoSt, Power Glove ofc, John MotherF**kin' Carpenter.
I've never been so taken aback by a new genre before and i can already tell this music will stay with me till my end.
*Thank you, Lazerhawk Perturbator for being a newbie's guide to an amazing future.*
Please suggest some more artists you love.

WRITING.TEXT:
Kraftwerk (German pronunciation: [kaftvk], "power station") is a German electronic music band formed by Ralf Htter and Florian Schneider in 1970 in Dsseldorf.
In the 1970s, they were among the first successful pop acts to popularize electronic music and are widely considered to be innovators and pioneers of the genre.
Here's, ["The Robots"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VXa9tXcMhXQ) from their 1978 album, Die Mensch-Maschine.

WRITING.TITLE: Grandfathers of Electronic music, German electronic band Kraftwerk in late 1970s

WRITING.TEXT:
I love the industrial, post-modern, neon theme sounds of 1980's. Like the OST's of Blade Runner, Tron John Carpenter's compositions.
PLease suggest me some songs of similar vibe and/or sounds.

*As per wikipedia-*
"Only the Lonely (Know the Way I Feel)" is a 1960 song written by Roy Orbison and Joe Melson. Orbison's recording of the song, produced by Fred Foster for Monument Records, was the first major hit for the singer. As an operatic rock ballad, it was a sound unheard of at the time[citation needed] and was described by The New York Times as expressing "a clenched, driven urgency".
Released as a 45 rpm single by Monument Records in May 1960, "Only the Lonely" went to No. 2 on the United States Billboard pop music charts on 25 July 1960 (blocked by Brenda Lee's "I'm Sorry") and No. 14 on the Billboard R B charts. "Only the Lonely" reached Number One in the United Kingdom, a position it achieved on 20 October 1960, staying there for two weeks (out of a total of 24 weeks spent on the UK singles chart from 28 July 1960).
The personnel on the original recording included Orbison's session regulars Buddy Harman on drums, Floyd Cramer on piano and Bob Moore on bass, with Hank Garland and Harold Bradley on guitar.
